clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of a French Automated Web-based Smoking Cessation Program
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of a French Automated Web-based Smoking Cessation Program : a Randomized Controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Institut national de prevention et d'education pour la sante

clinical_study.source: Institut national de prevention et d'education pour la sante

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the effectiveness of a French fully automated web-based smoking cessation program known as the "coaching", by comparing it to an online self-help guide.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the percentage of abstinent people between the two arms of the trial, 6 months after inclusion
primary_outcome.description: The investigators will compare the percentage of smokers who successfully quit, 6 months after their inclusion in the study. Point prevalence abstinence will be measured (not smoking, event a puff, in the week preceding the questioning).

arm_group.description: Those in the "coaching" arm will benefit from e-mails with advice, information, support for smoking cessation. These mails will be adapted to their personal profile.
Those in the "active comparator arm" will be allowed to download a self-help guide with step-by-step advice for smoking cessation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged 18 and older
- Smoker
- Willing to quit smoking in the next two weeks
- Having a regular access to Internet
- Having a personal e-mail address
- Not having benefited from the "coaching" the investigators want to assess yet
Exclusion Criteria:
- No personal e-mail address
- Not able to give the informed consent
